channel.title: Authors on Anish Saxena
channel.description: Recent content in Authors on Anish Saxena

item.description:
Hi! I’m Anish Saxena, a PhD student at Georgia Tech. My interests lie at the intersection of computer architecture, systems, and security.

I work with Prof. Moin Qureshi in the Memory Systems Lab. We are exploring software and architectural techniques to tackle hardware and microarchitectural vulnerabilities.

As an undergrad, I worked with Prof. Biswabandan Panda at IIT Kanpur. We investigated cache attack optimizations (DABANGG Attack) and analyzed compression and memory tracing techniques for mobile architectures. I also worked with Prof. Mahendra Verma to extend a high-performance scalable FFT library for GPUs.

From 2019 to 2021, I was a funded SRC Student Member as part of the DABANGG project. My projects on compression for mobile architectures and high-performance FFT library were done in close collaboration with Qualcomm Research and NVIDIA, respectively. I interned at Intel Labs and NVIDIA in summers of 2020 and 2021, respectively.
